author: barnabemonnot
content: has any behaviour of "incremental bidding" been observed by relays? e.g., builder A sends block with bid 1 ETH, then builder B pings the relay, sees the bid, bids 1.0000001 ETH or something. curious about it after seeing this tweet https://twitter.com/metachris/status/1583396517473587202 <@451519431647166464> <@532654603238375425>

author: barnabemonnot
content: oh nice! <@144468805697929216> curious how the data was obtained? are you pinging the relays at some high frequency?

author: jgm
content: There is a "bids received" endpoint on the relays from where this information can be obtained.

author: barnabemonnot
content: i tried pinging it but if I did that too often I would get rate-limited, and I don't think it was showing all the bids, it seemed to replace the bids from the same builder if they would update them...

author: jgm
content: I fetch for specific slots after the slot times are over, so once per 12 seconds.
